title: ICE on invalid code

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
Rust compiler is failing on bad code. I had just refactored from using `UnboundedSender` from `futures::sync::mpsc`, to using it as `mpsc::UnboundedSender` but I missed a spot. The commit that fixes the issue is [here](https://github.com/rjs-team/rjs/commit/e6d5d7a0c8b5f7378c99a321ccc97d7db2ae49b3), the code at the [previous commit](https://github.com/rjs-team/rjs/commit/9cd51a2594a6acc1e53286d463bde45eab227e86) is the one that actually crashes. I was running it with `env RUSTFLAGS="-Z external-macro-backtrace" RUST_BACKTRACE=full cargo run test.js`

```
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.24.0-nightly (edbd7d232 2017-12-20) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'explicit panic', /checkout/src/librustc_typeck/check/cast.rs:110:17
note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace.

```
